title._content: [Dancers, Nola's, New York, N.Y., ca. Feb. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Dancers, Nola's, New York, N.Y., ca. Feb. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Girls in the line at the Vanity Fair rehearsing routine before opening. These beauties catch much eye as they walk around the studios in shorts. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 261 Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Nola Studios is meeting place for NYC musicians," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 5 (Feb. 26, 1947), p. 15. Subjects: Vanity Fair Dancers--1940-1950. Nola's Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.14511 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 1451
